question: The world’s largest ‘Export Cold Zone’ was unveiled at which among the following airport of India?
option4: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport
explanation: The world’s largest ‘Export Cold Zone’ was unveiled at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, Mumbai. It will help for the processing and storage of agro and pharma products. The operational capability of the zone is 700 tonnes of cargo at one time.
